descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Continuation of MENU: Abstract Algebra sequence. Field theory; Galois theory. 331 differs from 330 in that
it covers more topics in more depth and aims at intensive development of students' ability to analyze and create
mathematical proofs. Students may not receive credit for corresponding quarters of both 330 and 331. Prerequisite: 291-3; 240 and 300; or consent of department.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisite: 291-3; 240 and 300; or consent of department.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
ISBN: 978-0471433347 Abstract Algebra, 3rd ed
Dummit and Foote
Wiley

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: Students may not receive credit for corresponding quarters of both 330 and 331.
